questions_and_groups.help_text: If the participant refuses this collection, select refused. otherwise select continue.
questions_and_groups.text: I will now collect a blood sample. I will need to ask you some questions before I collect your blood sample.

questions_and_groups.help_text: Response determines eligibility of study participant for blood draw.
questions_and_groups.text: Do you have hemophilia or any bleeding disorder?
Because you have hemophilia, we will not be able to draw your blood for this study.
Because you do not know or declined to answer questions about your hemophilia we will not be able to draw your blood.

questions_and_groups.help_text: Response determines eligibility of study participant for blood draw.
questions_and_groups.text: Do you take any blood thinning medication, such as Coumadin or warfarin?
Because you are taking a blood thinning medication, we will not be able to draw your blood at this time.
Because you do not know or declined to answer questions about your use of blood thinners we will not be able to draw your blood.

questions_and_groups.help_text: Response determines eligibility of study participant for blood draw.
questions_and_groups.text: Have you had cancer chemotherapy within the past 4 weeks?
Because you’ve had chemotherapy recently, we will not be able to draw your blood at this time.
Because you do not know or declined to answer questions about your chemotherapy status of blood thinners we will not be able to draw your blood.
Have you had any problems with taking blood in the past?

questions_and_groups.help_text: Select all that apply.
questions_and_groups.text: What problems did you have with taking blood in the past?

questions_and_groups.help_text: If there were any problems with a past blood draw that are not listed in the previous question, record the problem below

questions_and_groups.text: When was the last time you had anything to eat or drink other than water?

questions_and_groups.help_text: Record the time as HH:MM, be sure to fill the space with a zero when necessary and to mark the box to choose "AM" or "PM". For example, if the last time participant ate or drank was at 2:05PM record "02:05" and choose "PM".
questions_and_groups.text: Last time ate or drank – TIME
Last time ate or drank – AM/PM

questions_and_groups.help_text: Double check if year is < 2011.
questions_and_groups.text: Last time ate or drank – DATE
Have you had coffee or tea with sweetener or milk in the last 8 hours?
Have you had alcohol such as beer, wine, or liquor in the last 8 hours?
Have you chewed gum, or used breath mints, lozenges, cough drops, or other cough or cold remedies in the last 8 hours?
Have you used antacid, laxatives, or anti-diarrheal medication in the last 8 hours?
Have you taken a dietary supplement such as vitamins or minerals in the last 8 hours?
Are you diabetic? This includes gestational diabetes?
Have you taken any insulin in the last 8 hours?
Thank you for answering my questions. I am now going to prepare to draw your blood

questions_and_groups.help_text: - Confirm that blood tubes are labeled and not expired prior to collection of sample.
- Be sure to employ universal precautions to prevent exposure to infectious diseases at all times when handling biological specimens.
- Wear ppe including a lab coat and gloves until samples are sealed in transport bag.
- Be sure to explain each part of procedure being performed during blood collection.
- Once in an area with adequate light and a flat, clean surface free of food, clutter and distractions, begin set up.
- Ideally the prep area should be near a place where the participant can sit with her/his arm stretched out on a flat surface.
- Drape a chux pad over surfaces where the participant will put her/his arm.
- Stop drawing blood if bruising occurs. continue after three minutes only with verbal permission of participant.
- Collection tubes should be drawn in the following order: tube_type.
- Once collection is complete, remove the needle and apply gauze.

Check if clotting has occurred and apply band-aid over gauze. If necessary, instruct participant to raise her arm above her head for two minutes without bending her elbow to prevent the formation of a hematoma.

Select "Collected" to indicate that all blood tubes are filled to at least 3/4 of the desired capacity. desired capacity is defined as filled to the fill line indicated on the blood tube label. this choice should not be selected if there are any partially filled tubes. select "Partially collected" to indicate that at least one, but not all of the blood tubes is filled to at least 3/4 of the desired capacity. select "Not collected" to indicate that no blood tubes were collected.

questions_and_groups.text: Data collector: is this visit participant’s first visit (pre-pregnancy or pregnancy visit 1)?

questions_and_groups.help_text: Scan tube_type barcode. If the barcode scanner is not working, manually enter the information. Format # # # # # #

Select "Full draw" to indicate that the blood tube was filled to at least 3/4 of the desired capacity. desired capacity is defined as filled to the fill line indicated on the blood tube label. Select "Short draw" to indicate that the blood tube was filled to less than 3/4 of the desired capacity. Select "No draw" to indicate that the blood tube was not collected.

Record where blood collection occurred
Enter reason blood was not collected
Record whether blood will be centrifuged at collection location
questions_and_groups.text: Will blood be centrifuged at collection location?

questions_and_groups.help_text: Enter equipment id for centrifuge. Format should be AAA # # # # # # # # #.

Record the time the blood tubes were placed in the centrifuge. Record the time as HH:MM. Be sure to fill the space with a zero when necessary and to mark the box to choose "AM" or "PM". For example, if time of last urination was at 2:05PM record "02:05" and choose "PM". Double check if hour is not between 01 and 12. Double check if minutes are not between 00 and 59. Fill the space with 0 as necessary
Double check if year is < 2011.

Record the time the blood tubes were placed in the centrifuge. Record the time as HH:MM. Be sure to fill the space with a zero when necessary and to mark the box to choose "AM" or "PM". For example, if time of last urination was at 2:05PM record "02:05" and choose "PM". Double check if hour is not between 01 and 12. Double check if minutes are not between 00 and 59. Fill the space with 0 as necessary
Double check if year is < 2011.
If able to measure temperature, then select "Temperature". If not able to measure temperature, then select "Not able to measure".

Record the temperature reading on the digital thermometer attached to the centrifuge at the time that the blood tubes are removed after centrifugation. Enter temperature in degrees celsius. Record the temperature to the first decimal point. Double check if temperature is < 15C or > 28C

answers.text: Yes, at least one tube hemolyzed and at least one tube did not hemolyze
No, none of the tubes hemolyzed

questions_and_groups.help_text: Record whether hemolysis occurred in one or more of the blood tubes
Select all that apply
Select all that apply
Enter centrifuge comments:
Enter centrifuge comments:

questions_and_groups.text: - Prepare the tubes for transport in either the refrigerated clamshell or in the ambient tube holder, depending on the tube type and location of centrifugation.
- Place a lower threshold (0°C) monitor inside the refrigerated clamshell and inside the ambient tube holder (if applicable).
- Activate an upper threshold (20°C) monitor and affix it to the outside of the refrigerated clamshell
- If able to measure temperature, then select "temperature". enter the temperature of the digital thermometer in the transport cooler at the time the data collector puts the specimen in the cooler.
- If not able to measure temperature, then select "Not able to measure".
- If there are not any tubes that require refrigerated transport temperatures, then select "Not applicable".

questions_and_groups.help_text: Record the temperature of the refrigerated chamber of the transport cooler. Enter temperature in degrees celsius. Double check if temperature is ≥ 10C or if ≤ 0C

Record status of the low threshold monitor in the refrigerated chamber of the transport cooler. If there are not any tubes that require refrigerated transport temperatures, then select "No, not in chamber".
questions_and_groups.text: Status of refrigerated chamber low threshold monitor

questions_and_groups.help_text: Record status of the high threshold monitor in the refrigerated compartment of the cooler. If there are not any tubes that require refrigerated transport temperatures, then select "No, not in chamber".
questions_and_groups.text: Status of refrigerated chamber high threshold monitor

questions_and_groups.help_text: Record status of the low threshold monitor in the ambient compartment of the cooler.  If there are not any tubes that require ambient transport temperatures, then select  "No, not in chamber".
questions_and_groups.text: Status of ambient low threshold monitor

questions_and_groups.help_text: Enter blood collection comments
Enter any other blood collection comments
